extendedIngredients.name: fresh shiitake mushrooms
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 pound fresh shiitake mushrooms, stemmed and caps thinly sliced

title: Cabbage-and-Mushroom Toasts
summary: Cabbage-and-Mushroom Toasts is a vegetarian recipe with 8 servings. For $1.81 per serving, this recipe covers 8% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains approximately 2g of protein, 23g of fat, and a total of 236 calories. This recipe from Food and Wine has 1 fans. If you have butter, porcini mushrooms, garlic clove, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 1 hour. With a spoonacular score of 24%, this dish is rather bad. Similar recipes include Cabbage-and-Mushroom Toasts, Mushroom Toasts with Rocchetta, and Artichoke & Mushroom Toasts.
instructions: In a small heatproof bowl, cover the dried porcini with 1 cup of boiling water and let stand until softened, about 15 minutes. Drain the porcini and reserve the soaking liquid. Finely chop the porcini.                                              In a large skillet, melt 2 tablespoons of the butter. Add the porcini and shiitake and season with salt and pepper. Cook over high heat, stirring occasionally, until the shiitake are softened and lightly browned, about 8 minutes. Add the shallot and garlic and cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the porcini soaking liquid, stopping before you reach the grit at the bottom. Boil until the liquid is evaporated, about 5 minutes. Scrape the mixture into a bowl.                                              Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter to the skillet. Add the cabbage, season with salt and pepper and cook over moderately low heat, stirring frequently, until the cabbage is very tender, about 15 minutes. Add a few tablespoons of water to the skillet if it looks dry. Return the mushroom mixture to the skillet. Add the cream and tarragon and simmer until the cream is nearly evaporated, about 5 minutes.                                              Heat a cast-iron grill pan. Brush the bread with oil and grill over high heat, turning once, until toasted. Spread the cabbage-mushroom mixture on the toasts and serve.

steps.step: In a small heatproof bowl, cover the dried porcini with 1 cup of boiling water and let stand until softened, about 15 minutes.
Drain the porcini and reserve the soaking liquid. Finely chop the porcini.
In a large skillet, melt 2 tablespoons of the butter.
Add the porcini and shiitake and season with salt and pepper. Cook over high heat, stirring occasionally, until the shiitake are softened and lightly browned, about 8 minutes.
Add the shallot and garlic and cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Add the porcini soaking liquid, stopping before you reach the grit at the bottom. Boil until the liquid is evaporated, about 5 minutes. Scrape the mixture into a bowl.
Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter to the skillet.
Add the cabbage, season with salt and pepper and cook over moderately low heat, stirring frequently, until the cabbage is very tender, about 15 minutes.
Add a few tablespoons of water to the skillet if it looks dry. Return the mushroom mixture to the skillet.
Add the cream and tarragon and simmer until the cream is nearly evaporated, about 5 minutes.
Brush the bread with oil and grill over high heat, turning once, until toasted.
Spread the cabbage-mushroom mixture on the toasts and serve.
